definition: to plan a project/to stand on tiptoe/Taiwan pr. [qi4]/abbr. for 企業|企业[qi3 ye4]
diagram/picture/drawing/chart/map/CL:張|张[zhang1]/to plan/to scheme/to attempt/to pursue/to seek
to have an axe to grind (idiom)

sentences.english: He fled to Brazil trying to escape the long armof the law.
sentences.chinese: 他逃到巴西，企圖逃避恢恢法網。

sentences.english: The white racists tried to keep down the Indians by force.
sentences.chinese: 白人種族主義者企圖用武力壓服印第安人。

sentences.english: He jumped onto the table, turned over the cage tried to catch me.
sentences.chinese: 它跳上桌子，把籠子掀倒，企圖抓住我。

sentences.english: The inspectors soon saw through his scheme to avoid paying income tax.
sentences.chinese: 稽查員一眼就看穿了他企圖逃避繳納所得的詭計。

sentences.english: A prisoner was attempting to escape from a tower.
sentences.chinese: 一個囚犯企圖逃離關押他的塔。

sentences.english: She tried to disengage herself from his grip.
sentences.chinese: 她企圖掙脫他的牢牢抓住的手。

sentences.english: In the temple men drew near to God with music and pantomimes (out of this later the theatre developed).
sentences.chinese: 在聖殿的裏面，人類企圖親近上帝。

sentences.english: An attack on him was obviously an attempt to destabilise his country.
sentences.chinese: 攻擊他顯然是企圖破壞他國家的穩定。

sentences.english: He had sought to deprive us of dime .
sentences.chinese: 他企圖剝奪我們一角錢。

sentences.english: Attempts to paint the family as welfare scroungers have failed.
sentences.chinese: 把這個家庭的人描繪成福利敲詐者的企圖已經失敗了。

sentences.english: Someone tried to poison the water supply.
sentences.chinese: 有人企圖在供水系統裏放毒。

sentences.english: They tried to overcharge me, but I didn't agree.
sentences.chinese: 他們企圖向我漫天要價，但我沒同意。

sentences.english: The police fired into the air in an attempt to disperse the crowd.
sentences.chinese: 警察朝天開槍，企圖驅散人羣。

sentences.english: She tried to brownnose the boss by staying after work and helping him clean the room.
sentences.chinese: 她企圖在下班後呆下來幫老闆清掃房間以討好他。

sentences.english: I remember that for one hundred years, they have set their armies to destroy us.
sentences.chinese: 我記得這百餘年來它們不停地派軍隊來企圖消滅我們。

sentences.english: He tried to suborn the police.

definition: to declare to be untrue/to deny
to attack/to accuse/to charge/an attack (terrorist or military)
to seize an opportunity/to take advantage of situation
and/furthermore/also/together with/(not) at all/simultaneously/to combine/to join/to merge
